title: Understanding Social Phenomena Through Computer Science Metaphors

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental computer operation principles and understanding of social interactions
context.additional_context: Learners participate in projects combining digital tools and analog activities using personal devices, experiencing the reinterpretation of social studies content through computer science concepts

learning_goals: Learners can apply metaphorical meanings of various computer science terms (e.g., network, algorithm, cloud) to social phenomena
Learners can analyze similarities between computer and social systems through a conceptual framework and present three or more comparative cases
Learners can visually express metaphorical thinking through digital project outputs (visual models, simulations, etc.)
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
